definition: curtain or screen/canopy or tent/headquarters of a general/act (of a play)
(fig.) to raise the curtain/to lift the curtain/to be a curtain raiser for

sentences.english: sons and daughters of China opened a prelude to invasion.
sentences.chinese: 虎门销烟揭开了中华儿女反侵略的序幕。

sentences.english: The talent show in the evening drew the curtain with guitar playing.
sentences.chinese: 晚间的才艺表演在吉它的弹唱中拉开序幕。

sentences.english: There are three big-scale education innovations in Song Dynasty respectively, namely Qingli Education Innovations, Xining Education Innovations and Chongning Education Innovations.
sentences.chinese: 范仲淹庆历兴学掀开了宋代三次大规模兴学的序幕。

sentences.english: Bagpipes and dancing open the competitions of local sporting events, which are called Highland Gatherings.
sentences.chinese: 高地风笛与利尔舞揭开了高地运动盛会的序幕。

sentences.english: Joey and his buddies kicked off their summer vacation with a trip to the beach.
sentences.chinese: 乔伊和他的死党以一场海滩之旅来为璁假揭开序幕。

sentences.english: The prelude of the night is commenced in the music of the sunset.
sentences.chinese: 晚间的序幕于夕阳的乐曲声中揭开。

sentences.english: So the live-action drama is also called the "Prelude of detective conan".
sentences.chinese: 所以生活动作戏也被称为“名侦探柯南的序幕”。

sentences.english: And so the age-old fight over land and food has begun anew.
sentences.chinese: 就这样，一场古老的土地与食物争夺战又拉开了序幕。

sentences.english: After the introduction, we'll fade in the first scene.
sentences.chinese: 我们在序幕之后，就使第一个场景淡入。

sentences.english: The concert in the solemn GuoGeSheng in between the two countries.
sentences.chinese: 音乐会在庄严的中俄两国国歌声中拉开序幕。

sentences.english: SingSong chorus's wonderful singing opened the preface of the commencement.
sentences.chinese: 杏声悠扬美妙的歌声为典礼揭开序幕。

sentences.english: The event kicks off with performances by a live accordion band .
sentences.chinese: 欢庆活动由一个手风琴乐团的现场演奏揭开序幕。

sentences.english: Surprisingly, the fights start off with a graceful dance.
sentences.chinese: 令人惊讶的是，格斗以优雅的舞蹈揭开序幕。

sentences.english: Party in a cheerful sound of gongs and drums kicked off.
sentences.chinese: 联欢会在一片欢快的锣鼓声中拉开序幕。

sentences.english: The awards ceremony kicked off with an orchestra performance.
sentences.chinese: 管弦乐团的表演为这个颁奖典礼揭开序幕。

sentences.english: The telephone rings and this marks the prelude to an unforseen series of catastrophes .
sentences.chinese: 这标志着拉开了一连串意想不到的大灾难序幕。

definition: (fig.) to raise the curtain/to lift the curtain/to be a curtain raiser for
to start shooting or firing/to win an initial success/to succeed (of a plan)
to pull open/to pull apart/to space out/to increase
the curtain drops/the end of the show
to unfold/to carry out/to be in full swing/to launch
